Package edu.msoe.swe2721.lab9

Class ConsoleCalculator

java.lang.Object
edu.msoe.swe2721.lab9.ConsoleCalculator
public class ConsoleCalculator extends Object
This class will implement the console calculator.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private boolean
    allIntegers
    This attribute will keep track of whether all numbers input thus far are integers or not.
    private double
    currentResult
    This attribute will store the current result for the given calculator, which is the result of all operations up until the last operation was performed.

  • Field Details

    • allIntegers

      private boolean allIntegers
      This attribute will keep track of whether all numbers input thus far are integers or not.

    • currentResult

      private double currentResult
      This attribute will store the current result for the given calculator, which is the result of all operations up until the last operation was performed.

  • Constructor Details

    • ConsoleCalculator

      public ConsoleCalculator()
      This is the default constructor.
      1. set allIntegers to true.
      2. set currentResult to 0;

  • Method Details

    • processLine

      public void processLine(String lineOfText)
      This method will process a line of text that has been read in from the console.
      1. Instantiate a scanner.
      2. While the scanner has a next token and processing is to continue.
        1. Determine if the scanner has a next int. If so,
          1. read in the integer
          2. set all ints to be true
          3. setandprint the current result to be the value read in.
        2. Otherwise if the scanner has a next double.
          1. read in the double
          2. set all ints to be false
          3. setandprint the current result to be the value read in.
        3. Otherwise the line is starting with a non-numeric value.
          1. Read in the text which should be the operand.
          2. If the line has a next int or next double.
            1. If the next number is an integer, read in the next int.
            2. If the next line is a double, read in the next double and set the allIntegers field to be false.
          3. Based on the operand, call the appropriate method.
            • If +, handle the Add operation
            • If -, handle the subtract operation.
            • If *, handle the multiply operation
            • If /, handle the divide operation.
            • If C, handle clear and set keep processing to be false to exit out of the loop, abandoning processing of the rest of the line.
            • If =, handle equals and set keep processing to be false to exit out of the loop, abandoning processing of the rest of the line.
      Parameters:
      lineOfText - This is a string that has been obtained from the user and is to be processed by this class.

    • printNewline

      private void printNewline()
      This method will print out to the console a newline separator (i.e. the character that will cause a new line to print on the console. Hint: This may be different depending on the environment you are executing in.
      See Also:
      • Javadoc for System class.

    • printNumber

      private void printNumber(double value)
      This method will print out values to the console.

      If the allIntegers field is true, then the number should be printed out as if it is an integer. If the number is the same as its value when cast to an integer, it also should be printed out as an integer (i.e. 1.0 should print as 1.) If the number is not an integer value, then it should print out as the shortest floating point humber possible (i.e. any trailing 0's should be removed)

      Parameters:
      value - This is the value to be printed. Note that the value to be printed should be in the range of a long even though it is a double, and is only expected to be accurate to 8 decimal digits.
      See Also:
      • How to nicely format floating numbers to string without unnecessary decimal 0's

    • setAndPrintCurrentResult

      private void setAndPrintCurrentResult(double currentResult)
      This method will set the current result and print it out to the console using the appropriate method.
      Parameters:
      currentResult - This is the current result that is to be set.

    • handleEquals

      private void handleEquals()
      This method will handle the pressing of the equals button.

      It will

      1. Print out to the console an equals sign with spaces on each side.
      2. print the current result out in a formatted manner.
      3. Print out a newline.

    • handleAdd

      private void handleAdd(double addend)
      This method will handle an addition operation, when the user intends to add a value to a previously entered value.

      It will

      1. Add the addendund to the current result.
      2. Print out the + sign to the console.
      3. Print a newline
      4. Print the current result in the appropriate format.
      Parameters:
      addend - This is the value that is to be added to the current result.

    • handleSubtract

      private void handleSubtract(double subtractend)
      This method will handle a subtraction operation, when the user intends to subtract a value from a previously entered value.

      It will

      1. Subtract the subtractend from the current result.
      2. Print out the + sign to the console.
      3. Print a newline
      4. Print the current result in the appropriate format.
      Parameters:
      subtractend - This si the value that is to be subtracted.

    • handleMultiply

      private void handleMultiply(double multiplier)
      This method will handle a multiplication operation, when the user intends to multiply a value to a previously entered value.

      It will

      1. Multiply the current result by the multiplier.
      2. Print out the * sign to the console.
      3. Print a newline
      4. Print the current result in the appropriate format.
      Parameters:
      multiplier - This is the value that is to be multiplied by.

    • handleDivide

      private void handleDivide(double dividend)
      This method will handle a divide operation, when the user intends to divide the previous value by a given divident.

      It will

      1. Determine if the division operation results in a remainder of 0. If not, set allIntegers to false.
      2. Divide the current result by the dividend.
      3. Print out the / sign to the console.
      4. Print a newline
      5. Print the current result in the appropriate format.
      Parameters:
      dividend - This is the value that is to be divided by.

    • handleClear

      private void handleClear()
      This method will handle the clear operation. In doing so, it will
      1. Set the current result to 0.
      2. Reset all integers to true.
      3. Print out a newline character to the console.
